body:
Current serving personnel should speak to their unit HR regarding all medals.

Use this service to apply for medals awarded:

- during your military career
- to someone you have lasting power of attorney for during their military career
- to a deceased family member during their career

This service only provides medals awarded by:

- Army
- Home Guard
- Royal Air Force
- Royal Navy
- Royal Marines
- Reserve forces

If you’re applying on behalf of someone using lasting power of attorney you’ll need:

- details of the person’s military career
- evidence of lasting power of attorney

### If you’re applying for someone else’s medal

You can apply on behalf of a veteran if you have [lasting power of attorney](https://www.gov.uk/power-of-attorney).

If the veteran has died, you must be the official next of kin. The general rules are:

- the person’s spouse or civil partner has first claim to the medal, and then the eldest child
- if there’s no spouse or child, the eldest grandchild is entitled to apply

Applying takes around 5 minutes.
heading: Apply for a military service medal
